page.title: 18 FIRE STATION KETTERING
page.content: The station, built in 1955 employs 30 full time and 16 part time men. Training consists of 14 weeks' basic. 0ne year trial and a further 4 years. Each man does daily fire drill. There are 2 fire engines, 1 water tender and an hydraulic platform. When called to a fire by a bleeper alarm, it takes 1 minute to get into an engine. On the way they change into fire gear and radio a doctor if medical help is required. They add to the 18,000l.of water carried by drawing from the mains in the streets and also use dry powder, carbon dioxide and foam. In 1984 there were 517 fires put out in the area. Most were at night and caused by carelessness. In the case of very big fires, they have travelled up to 60 miles.
